content: Ive been in the back surfing this forum for a while and joined for help on this issue. My situation. I want to get back in the Military to go EOD. I have done my homework and talked to friends of mine that are techs and SEALS that they are attached to. I am prior service Navy and want to go Navy or Army EOD. Now here is the trouble. I have an SFJ-RE2 code. I was medically retired for my right foot. Ive had operations while on active duty and ran out of LIMDU time to get better. I have since recovered and am confident I am %100. I have been working with motivators and training pretty damn hard because I really want this. My question. What are my chances of getting back in and accepted in this program? And what steps would I need to take? I am not worried about the physical part. I know how difficult the course work is to those that do NOT have good study habbits. Again, I am prepared for this and I have done my homework. This might have to be answered by those salty sailors that have been dealing with these situations.

title: Here is a wrench in your gears for you Recruiters. Please Help

content: Ask your question Here. We wish you the best, please keep us posted. God and the soldier, All men adore, In time of trouble, And no more; For when war is over, And all things righted, God is neglected - The old soldier slighted. Founding Member Original DVG & Proud Member, Rupterd Duck/Derelict Veterans

content: Good luck, it's not going to be easy to convince them! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!

title: Here is a wrench in your gears for you Recruiters. Please Help

content: EOD and a bad foot. What if the thing goes "click" and you got 5 seconds to cover 40 yards to cover to stay alive - can you do it? Some day, that's what it could come down to - - Wandering and Wondering
